Create a game concept with the following details:

- Multiplayer Support: Online Multiplayer

- Development Time: 12 months
- Budget: $10,000
- Core Mechanics: Combat, Exploration, Crafting
- Mood/Atmosphere: Epic, Mysterious
- Inspiration: The Witcher, Skyrim
- Unique Features: Dynamic weather system affecting gameplay
- Detail Level: High

## Tech Design

Quick summary: Build on Unreal Engine 5 for a first‑person immersive sim with heavy diegetic UI and systemic logic. Target PC/PS5/XSX|S at 60 fps (30/60 on Series S). Author modular interior environments, deterministic “risk graph” systems, and a data‑driven Ghost manipulation layer. Use a lean backend (PlayFab/EOS) for async contracts and optional two‑player co‑op. Keep lighting and VFX scalable, prioritize text/UI readability, and ship within a $5–8M, 24‑month AA scope through

## Tech Design

Executive direction
- Engine: Unity 2022/2023 LTS with URP. It matches the isometric, stylized look, Switch support, and your perf/budget constraints. We avoid high-cost features (dynamic GI, complex transparency) and lean on baked lighting, SRP Batcher, and Addressables.
- Network: Lightweight, session-based co-op with relay-backed NAT traversal and no PII collection. Host-authoritative logic, action-level replication, and deterministic UI graph ops.
- Tooling: Data-driven conte

## Tech Design

Overview
- Project: Gray Ledger (narrative strategy/thriller with investigative graph puzzles, policy trade-offs, and hearings)
- Scope: Indie AA, 16–18 months, 12–15 core team, PC first; Deck/console second
- Design constraints: Abstract/fictional patterns (no real evasion details), accessibility-first, deterministic scenarios for optional async multiplayer

## Tech Design

Overview
- Project: Emergency Override
- Platforms: PC (Windows), PS5, Xbox Series X|S
- Engine: Unreal Engine 5.3+
- Modes: Single-player campaign (core). Optional asynchronous “Public Rituals” and limited 2-player co-op “Honeypot Heists”
- Goal: AA scope with a credible indie-plus fallback. Stealth/systemic immersive sim centered on verification mechanics, fail-forward state, and readable “trustpunk” visuals

  - Unreal Engine

- We will not remove safety checks or input validation. Both the game’s systems and our dev pipeline model “speed with integrity.” We achieve efficiency via risk-tiered fast lanes, automation, and high-signal tooling—not by stripping safeguards.
